text: Robbie: Heather?

Holly: Heather, come on!
This isn't funny anymore.

I still can't believe
we lost our little sister.
( howling )

What was that?
Was it a wolf?

There are no wolves
around here.

There's bears.
There's plenty of bears.

- ( howling )
- You sure about that?
( growling )

Sounds like
it's getting louder.

- ( branch snaps )
- Did you hear that?
Shh.

Stand tall
and don't show fear.
( growling )

- ( roars )
- Aah!

- Heather!
- Got you, suckers.
What a bunch of scaredy cats.
And wolves?

There are no wolves
this far south.

Okay. Just get back to the
campsite and find Mom and Dad.

Just one question.
Where is that?
I'm so hungry.
What if we literally starve?

There's much more chance
that we'll die of exposure.

So we should probably
build a fire then?

- Does anyone have a match?
- Bet Mom does.

If we die out here,
Mom is going to be so sorry
she brought us camping.

But then her last memory
of me will be our fight.

I'm sorry
I called you pathetic.
Tanked my SATs again.
Worse than last time.

What am I supposed to do?
I'm not like you.
I don't have music.
My brain is mush.

Every time
I pick up my guitar

I'm worried that
I'll write something
that'll make someone mad.

You'll figure it out.
You always do.
I didn't with the musical.

- What if I'm not good?
- At?

Anything. I'm not even
a good person right now.

I support Mom
taking this new job,

but I just really miss
having her around.

That probably
would've been a nice thing
to say to her earlier.
Just saying.

I can't control whether
the world likes my music,
but I can control whether

I'm a good sibling
and daughter.
We need to find the creek.

If we can do that,
we can follow it upstream.

So be quiet
and listen for water.
